definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
Qieyun, the first Chinese rime dictionary from 601 AD, containing 11,500 single-character entries
Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
Min dialects, spoken in Fujian Province, Taiwan etc
thirty six initial consonants of Song phonetic theory
rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
ancient (esp. pre-Qin) pronunciation of a Chinese character/classical speech sounds
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
